intro: Rhinanthus vollmannii, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and dunes. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Rhinanthus vollmannii plays a role in supporting pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
